website_summaries.verdict: Extra-large container is perfect for long trips.
pros: Durable bottle doesn’t expand or leak water even in the car
Conveniently placed handle makes the travel bowl easy to carry
Water is easy to access even when levels are running low
Bowl sits at a low price point
cons: Bowl opening is on the smaller side, may not be the best for larger dogs

customer_reviews.title: Really a GREAT item IF it had a water tight closable lid to slip over the bowl opening.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for a "single source" water station, at home-on the road-wherever. She always has "her" water and really likes using it. Stable and doesn't "slosh" much even with being jostled around. The only way this would be "spill proof" would be when EMPTY. The one thing it should come with is a softish/friction fit/snap on lid similar to plastic food containers/tupperware type, that fit tight over "bowl ring/opening" so the jug could be packed upright (as pictured) and not slosh water on the stuff packed with it. If I could find some covers like that, I would get multiple jugs so I could pack up more water for extended trips.
customer_reviews.author: MountainMan

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!  Not made like they used to be made.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these bowls a number of years ago. They both performed beautifully all these years until I accidentally left one in a hotel room in another state. So I ordered two more. Such a disappointment, the quality and manufacturing seems to have changed dramatically. If tipped even a little bit the water leaks right through the flimsy gasket onto the floor on both bowls. I even had my engineer husband look at them to make sure it wasn’t operator error. This new, cheap design totally defeats its purpose. I’m very disappointed. They’re fine for on the kitchen floor, but if you’re traveling, it’s not the right product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie W.

customer_reviews.title: great for traveling dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our Labrador retriever for a 6 week cross country trip. She always had water available in the truck and there were no spills. We couldn't ask for more. I should have brought a bottle brush to really get it cleaned out each day because it was a little difficult getting my hand in there to get it all cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Cheslock

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me - big spills!
customer_reviews.text: I was psyched to find something to keep in the car for m my service dog who spends a lot of time in one. Despite being on a level surface (my dog has a platform in the back of my truck) I was dismayed to find a huge wet spot from spillage after a 20minute drive. And I was careful not to over fill it. Just plain didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: VA1999NJ

customer_reviews.title: Water does not come out correctly
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the photo, the waterline is wayyyy too low unless I fill up the entire bottle and I had to put a 40lbs kettlebell to ensure there’s enough water out for my dog to drink. The worst part is that once my dog drink the water , even with the weight the water does NOT come back up. I had to lift and put down the weight and let it pump up more water...
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we were taking our dog aboard a houseboat in 100 degree temperatures for a week. There was also a long, 5 hour car ride to get to our destination. Both in the car and in the houseboat this worked great. Our dog was able to drink as much as he wanted. The availability of this bowl meant that we didn't need to worry about spills and our dog stayed safe, hydrated, and comfortable. The large capacity meant we didn't have to worry about him running out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: May work well for some, but not for others
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but you have to keep it nearly full for the dogs to get enough water. Also, it is tough to clean when algae invades the inside. Finally, there's too much splashing to use in car IMO. May work really well for some, but not for others.
customer_reviews.author: Grinchy

customer_reviews.title: Still splashes water
customer_reviews.text: Bought this before our 2 week roadtrip with our dog so he could always have water when he wanted it and we wouldn't have to worry about water splashing everywhere. Our dog never had an issue with it, but we weren't impressed. It did leak if on uneven surface.. we had it sitting on the backseat and it still splashed water. It also leaked when picking it up if picked up to fast and the water didn't have time to drain back to the base. It was never filled past the fill line, so that wasn't the issue. It was still handy to have, just not as happy with the purchase as I anticipated to be.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Love these for travel! I had my original one for years. Only reason I had to buy a new one is I accidentally ran over the one I had. These are so convenient and my dogs are not able to tip it over. I travel at least monthly with my dogs for doggie events. I keep this water bowl in the hotel room since I have water pails in their crates. Super easy to fill and clean and I don't have to fill often. If it starts getting low I just pour water in the bowl and tilt it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I really like this water bowl for my dogs when traveling and camping. The only difficulty is when you take the cap off to clean the inside, it is difficult to put the cap back on with the rubber washer to keep it leakproof. Once you find the correct tightness without displacing the washer, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: DelawareMom

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to drive puppies across county. Leaked, hard for them to drink from and gave them a rash on their mouth...check to make sure your dogs aren’t allergic to this type of material. Also algae grew A LOT faster than anticipate. Changed and cleaned daily - that didn’t help
customer_reviews.author: S711

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful travel product
customer_reviews.text: By far the best travel bowl on the market. I have bought a number of these and they work great. The O ring can be a little finicky but otherwise the product is really useful. It is great for the car as one can fill it to the appropriate level and then transport it without water getting everywhere. It also holds enough water (unlike most of the competition) that you don't have to keep stopping to refill. It is one of those products which falls into the category of "Why didn't I think of that?". Only reason for 4 stars - not 5 is that it is overpriced for what it it is.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: So good we bought a second one for the back of the car....
customer_reviews.text: We have a little lhasa puppy who thinks a normal water dish is really just a small-dog swimming pool -- and dives in with both front paws and splashes until the dish is empty. We tried 3 different water bowls before finding this one -- and IT's SWIMMING-PROOF! She still likes to dip her face in up to the eyebrows and then jerk her head out and shake -- like a water sprinkler.... but I can't find a way around that one, lol. :D
customer_reviews.author: *Auntie L*

customer_reviews.title: Works well and well made.  Dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect travel bowl waterer for an RV. We liked the first one so much we bought a second one. Dogs love to drink from it. Some water will slosh out on occasion but rarely, usually when a dog accidentally steps in it or if we overfill it. Wonderful for road trips...
customer_reviews.author: Kim D

customer_reviews.title: I love this water dish
customer_reviews.text: I love this water dish, it is just such a clever design! I don't use it for travel, I use it as an every-day water dish for my dog and she immediately started drinking out of it, no problem getting her used to it. The opening is so large that I can add ice, and the water stays protected and clear even when we have a windy day or rain. It's so easy to fill and carry outside, I put ice water and ice cubes in this water container. We live in South Carolina and cold fresh water is always appreciated by Chloe. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not as watertight as suggested.
customer_reviews.text: Water constantly leaks out of the seal and holds less water than expected. Is difficult to clean the inside because of the moulded shape. Pros are: made of tough plastic and dogs gets no fuss quick access to water. No pouring or set up required.
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: It does have to be basically 3/4 full to have any water in the dispensing area but this worked fine for us
customer_reviews.text: Had this in the back of my SUV while we were traveling with our dog. I placed a towel underneath in case of spills but a 7 hour drive and we had minimal spillage! It does have to be basically 3/4 full to have any water in the dispensing area but this worked fine for us. I like that I can also take it to the dog park. Makes carrying water/bowl much easier.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our dog as we are taking a cross country road trip with him. Was so pleasantly shocked at this thing! I expected my dog to just ignore it but he likes it so much he'll even drink when the car is moving! No spills in the car, even why my dog tried to dig in it!
customer_reviews.author: Francine Darling

customer_reviews.title: Great for puppies
customer_reviews.text: Although this product is not perfect, it is the best thing I have found for a litter of puppies as to not get water everywhere. They are hard to keep clean and have to be changed out frequently, but better than anything else I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Luci Faucher

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for truck drivers with pets! We ordered 2 more since we liked it so much.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I drive an eighteen wheeler over the road. 6000 miles a week. We were looking for a bowl that would hold water without spilling for our dog Elsa. Works very well. We love it and haven't had a drop spill. We do a lot of stop and go driving in daily traffic jams and a lot of our route is on rough interstate. Elsa seems to like it and has no problem drinking from it. She is a standard poodle and bulldog mix. we ordered two more for home for our other dogs and cats. ( Our daughter takes care of them while we are gone. For those concerned )
customer_reviews.author: Michael Andrew Board

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea, but failed over time
customer_reviews.text: I really loves this when i first received it. It seemed to work great, and was perfect for the car and crate. I understood from others reviewers that is can and does leak if it is turned a certain way. But I was good with that. However, now it leaks in the correct position. And I can no longer use it. So I would not recommend this product based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Reins

customer_reviews.title: Good design, bad follow up
customer_reviews.text: Meaning the basic design is good if you fill it a little more than half way. It's sturdy too.However, it is NOT spill-proof. What you see in the pic, is what you get, no lid. The blue screw on cap/dish, sits deep in the container with holes on bottom that allow water to come into the blue 'dish' part which minimizes the 'sloshing about' of water but bumps while walking (holding upright), and humps & dips in the road if laying flat on a car ride, do indeed get surroundings wet. Not really bad, but enough to make ya think, "why no lid to close off completely?".
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Genius product
customer_reviews.text: Makes keeping pets hydrated easy. It doesn’t spill and is great for in vehicles. I give these as gifts to all my friend’s for their furry friends. They work well for feathered friends too. Works 100% as advertised. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again and can recommend for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. First one stayed in my truck for hmmmmm..... 3 years or more, winter, summer, freezing...... the "bowl" portion finally chipped.... not certain how..... but replaced in. Great for traveling and vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Bad when even the dog thinks it smells
customer_reviews.text: Great for on the go road trips etc... the first one I have I keep in the toyhauler for camping no problems 5 stars. I bought that one about 4 years ago. This time around I wanted one for the times we put the dogs in the crate. It smelt bad. We couldn't keep water in it with out it smelling like mildew. Maybe I just didn't get lucky with this "bad batch" plastic manufacture change? Bottom line we threw it away. The dogs wouldn't drink from it. We used purified water as well.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: A must have for travelling
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased. The first one only held up for 7 years and then the lid cracked when I ran over it. (The body itself is still intact.) The only time I've had water splash out was an unexpected slide out in the road.
customer_reviews.author: Gwenlyn Guinn

customer_reviews.title: Great non-spill travel water bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I like these bowls despite the fact that the colored screw on part broke too soon. Replacement part is $5, minimum order is $20 + shipping and handling. I had already bought this new bowl before getting a reply to my question about the cracked part. The new bowl has a different color screw on part so maybe it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: There is no lid or stopper!  So if you want to stand up somewhere you can’t!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great idea but it certainly isn’t spill proof! There’s also no lid or stopper so you can’t pick it up and carry it to your car and just lay it down! My first trip was 8 miles and in 15 minutes it spilled half the water all over the floor of my SUV! I would give it a zero if I could!
customer_reviews.author: bbcb0

customer_reviews.title: Good. Doesn't spill.
customer_reviews.text: I like this travel water bowl for keeping in the back of the hatchback. I can carry it to the dog park or into training easily. Does not spill. But if you pick it up wrong, you may get a little water spill if you aren't watching that the water that is out in the blue bowl is aimed to go back in. Easy enough to avoid once you realize it. Doesn't put a ton of water into the bowl, so when there is a big bowl of water or this, and my dog is really thirsty, he will choose the big bowl first. But if this is what there is, he drinks out of it just fine. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J Bug

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for travel. No worries when it comes to spills when we take it in the car and it eliminates the need to bring a travel water bowl. There is only a small amount of water in the bowl itself but it is for no spill purposes and it doesn't seem to bother my dog at all. She's a bit messy when drinking from it but she's messy with her large bowl at home so I doubt it's the fault of the product. I would recommend this and I would buy it again myself. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I have a litter of ten puppies and purchased this as a safe way for them to get drinking water. It works well enough, it's just the seams that leak horribly. I have to put layers of towels and waterproof pads under it so it doesn't ruin my floors. I tried to purchase another but the order was never fulfilled and I received a credit with no explanation. I could not be more disappointed in a product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Frey

customer_reviews.title: Works 😁 Great
customer_reviews.text: These are great I bought these particular ones for the RV but I also have more that are in each truck, I actually have them in some of the rooms as they don't splash around when the dog drinks out of them.
customer_reviews.author: PRFL

customer_reviews.title: Good bowl, but it does still result in some ...
customer_reviews.text: Good bowl, but it does still result in some spillage unless you only fill it a tiny bit. The problem with only filling it a tiny bit is that it'll run out quickly if you have multiple dogs, unless you have extra water bottles with you. However, it is a great water container to bring in the car that allows dogs to drink while you drive. It definitely is better than a normal bowl for travel purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Gambit and Jean Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great design and well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: My GSP puppy would stick her paws in her water bowl and make a mess every time the bowl was filled. Water would be everywhere and her bowl would be dry. No more. This thing is very well designed and constructed. Yes, it is great for traveling but for my particular case, it is an extra bonus. Don't be turned off by the small drinking are inside the bowl. Dogs only need a small hole to scoop water. The water inside as well as my floors stay nice and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Zoriontsu

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work for My Pups
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a "no spill' item. ... if over filled it does leak out. After attempting to use this after one trip up north with my pups ... I had to return it. I gave this a 2nd chance on the way home, put less water in it and it STILL leaked. Amazon was very good about accepting the return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful invention! We got one of these for our ...
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful invention! We got one of these for our pets in our RV because my sister as one at her house and I noticed a lack of drips and splashes around it. Our dog is the biggest slob so she does manage to keep some water on her face to drip on the floor BUT there is no spilling. When we drive the water stays in the bowl and we don't have to worry about giving the pets water while on the road. I did put some drops of silicone glue on the bottom to keep the bowl from sliding on the tile floor (only as a precaution-we had no trouble with it sliding).
customer_reviews.author: Libby Delano

customer_reviews.title: Simple, cheap, effective.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have 2 ferrets and 3 cats. One of the ferrets insists water tastes better off the floor once the bowl has been dumped. I have tried several different types of "no spill" bowls to no avail. I hate leaving all day knowing she is going to spill the water and then they all have to go without all day until I get home. With this, there is no spilling period. It holds a lot of water so I only have to fill it up every couple of days. It is easy to carry around and works exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 little dogs and 2 cats that share this waterer. It's only about half empty before the bowel stops filling it's self. However, the water stays cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Keeping your head above water
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for traveling with your dog. I used to bring a small bowl along, which I had to fill along the way, and which would splash around along the way. The Waterboy lets you fill it and carry it without spilling. It's big enough for ice cubes if you need to keep the water chilled. The water in the bowl isn't very deep but my dog hasn't had any trouble using it, and it holds plenty of water for a day's driving. The only caveat is that the O-ring around the threads for the bowl is delicate and it's very easy to over tighten and distort it.
customer_reviews.author: Direwolf

customer_reviews.title: Great, but grows green funk
customer_reviews.text: We bought this water bowl for our Griffon and Lab after seeing our neighbor have one for his dog. We have loved it for camping etc. The one thing I am not overly impressed with is how it grows green stuff on the inside. Since owning this I've had to bleach it out several times which I don't feel like the company tells you at all. They explain very little maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Riemenschneider

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It still leaks. She picks it up and it leaks, I pick it up to fill it, it leaks. If the water is to the fill line and she pushes on it, it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Peach

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Leaks. Difficult to line up cap correctly. Lost majority of water when flipped on side. This must be a knock off of an excellent brand I owned in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: it works great, I like how I can stand it up ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an upcoming camping trip I have planned. I wanted something for in the truck when I have to run into a store or something. I used it in the house to test it, it works great, I like how I can stand it up for when we are traveling, then bring it out for the dogs while we are stopped. No filling a dog bowl with a jug of water. Its an all in one dog water dish. Just stand it up behind the seat and when you want to give them water, lay it down.
customer_reviews.author: Old Lady camping

customer_reviews.title: leaks no matter how little water you put in there
customer_reviews.text: supposed to be leakproof, but has always leaked even with just a little bit of water in there. and then what's the point; the dogs can't get to it! it doesn't easily tip over, but the dogs definitely flip it if they can't get to the water in it. i didn't like it, and got rid of it and bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: ... about 7 years this new replacement one holds up great and gives us a much easier drinking source for ...
customer_reviews.text: Dogs have been using these for years now so they are used to it till I stepped on the old one and it broke after about 7 years this new replacement one holds up great and gives us a much easier drinking source for the dogs always clean and and the foe stone cap is a nice touch. Hopefully we will see many years more use out of this one too
customer_reviews.author: Crixe

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by how well this water bowl works. Several times a year we spend 6 - 8 hours traveling with our dog who has bladder issues. It's important that she stay hydrated, and while we do stop frequently I feel better knowing that now she can get water whenever she wants it. The bowl is well constructed and really does not spill. It's also nice to pick up a full water bowl and carry it in one hand while holding the leash in the other - something normal water bowls cannot do. The only thing improvement I can think of is if it had a non-slip texture on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Geek Girls Rule

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for a Old Problem
customer_reviews.text: Like the Waterboy. First purchased one when I relocated and was traveling in a moving van with my dog. Just placed it on the floor board and he would lean over the seat to get a drink. Did not have to worry about water emptying out because of bumps or turns plus it holds more than a standard water bowl. I now have two vehicles and to keep from moving the bowl from one to the other decided to get a second one as most of time I forget and after a walk in the park he did not have water. I've had the first one for five years and its still holding going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Loving It

customer_reviews.title: One of them was opened and used
customer_reviews.text: I like the waterboys in general But one of these was open and used!!! I can't really use it with my newborn puppies because Im afraid of the parvo virus!
customer_reviews.author: bbawkb

customer_reviews.title: great dog bowl for the car
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this can leak if you tip it wrong, but most positions it does not dowse my back seat, and dogs can drink out of it easily, and it carries easily. Great product. Not a huge water capacity if your dogs are big drinkers, but enough for my 2 for all day.
customer_reviews.author: flutekate

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I must get 2 people asking me about this water bowl every dog park trip. It works great because the dogs can't paw the water out of it, as they like to do. My dog would rather drink out of it than her regular stainless water dish at home. It works great in the car too, because we can road trip and she can get a drink without needing to stop. The only think I would say is you should buyto clean the handle because it gets gross overtime. I have had no problem with leaking and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does spill
customer_reviews.text: I like it for carrying water for the dog in the car. It does spill if it slips and falls. Best to keep it on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Coby

customer_reviews.title: Love the fact the dog can't tip this one over!
customer_reviews.text: Great portable water container/bowl that FINALLY the dog can't tip over! It's design probably works easier for dogs with long snouts (we have a Weimaraner) or long tongues since the water only dispenses into the very bottom of the bowl/fill cap. Seems to be less splash due to this too. So tipping it to allow more water to enter the bowl kind of defeats the purpose of its no tip-no spill function.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: water on the go
customer_reviews.text: Nice container for water to travel with, pretty easy to use, however...when the water table gets down to about 1/2 way, you have to prop the bottom of the container up a little bit, or the dogs cannot get water out. Does not spill, unless you misuse it. I use mine for dog training classes and dog shows.
customer_reviews.author: run2it

customer_reviews.title: Really works, worth the extra $, Malinois likes it too
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a cheaper version of a waterboy and it spilled way-easy. This one (except for what is already in the bowl) does not spill - even when turned upside-down! As best I can tell this is because the inflow is flush against the bottom of the reservoir. Whatever, it works. No water spills in the car, or doggie bed, or floor. In the kitchen, where I have a large fresh water glass bowl,, my Malinois working dog liked the Lixit, too. Easy carry for travel.
customer_reviews.author: RealiT

customer_reviews.title: Must have for travelling with pets
customer_reviews.text: Best travel water container I've ever used. It doesn't spill (unless you majorly overfill it). Perfect in any location. I take this everywhere with me when I have my dog with me. I suppose this would work well for cats as well. I've used many different types/brands of travel water containers and they have all had their drawbacks, this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Twinning_mom

customer_reviews.title: great for car rides
customer_reviews.text: This is great for car rides so the dogs still have water but it doesn't get all over the floor board of the car. I have a weeniepoo and a maltipoo. the only reason I gave this a 4 star is because the water doesn't fill high enough in the blue section. I have to splash it with my fingers so the dogs know there is water at the bottom because they think it is empty at first.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: It actually holds too much water for my dog and as I give her bottled water, expensive to toss. Also very little water gets into the drinking area, even when full, and it is hard for her to drink out of it. I have to hold it and tip it. After two days on a trip I just tossed it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta G. M.

customer_reviews.title: My Rotties finally like the bowl.
customer_reviews.text: It took my Rotties awhile to adjust to this water bowl/server. They took about 3 weeks to admit the bowl was on the floor next to their regular bowl. My cat found it first and used it immediately. Maybe the dogs didn't want cat spit in their water. The Rotties noses just fit in the bowl. A dog with a wider snout may not like putting their nose in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette Winder

customer_reviews.title: Product good, customer service - not so much
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great, although the product I received was missing the blue insert that prevents the water from spilling, and when I contacted the company to have them send me one I received no help in solving the problem. I am fortunate that I had my old one stashed in my garage to wash out the blue piece and use it in my newer, cleaner bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bowl that doesn't spill
customer_reviews.text: Great travel bowl. It doesn't spill and holds a decent amount of water. An added bonus is that a crawling baby cannot get it's head inside and drown like with regular dog bowls. The downside is that our granddaughter got her finger stuck in one of the holes. Fortunately I was able to remove it without hurting her. Our daughter stopped using it for her dogs after this happened. The other problem is that it is difficult to clean well, especially around the handle. A small design change could solve these minor problems.
customer_reviews.author: C. Taubman

customer_reviews.title: Works really well for moderately large dogs and smaller
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for holding a good amount of water without sloshing around your car. I'm a dog walker and I fill and leave it in the back of my car on hot days and all the dogs except my own readily drink from it without hesitation. My dog is a Pyrenees and can't seem to figure out the small opening. He will not even try to drink from it, no matter how thirsty he is and no matter that he sees other dogs drinking from it. But Labs, Goldens, and smaller dogs take to it instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. What prompted me to buy this, was that I bought a soft sided crate for my puppy because we are going on vacation and I wanted him to get used to it beforehand. Well, I had water bottles attached to the other crates but there is no way to attach one to the new crate, hence this little gadget. He tried to dig under it, he tried to knock it over but this water bowl does the job. It does not spill. He uses this now as his regular water bowl downstairs and I had to buy a second one for his night time crate upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Turner

customer_reviews.title: Not Spill-proof
customer_reviews.text: This water bowl IS NOT spill-proof! We bought it for our RV, and it sloshes over the sides on the best of roads! We're keeping it, as it fits in our bathroom sink when traveling and provides quite a bit of water when we're parked.
customer_reviews.author: East Bay Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a cover
customer_reviews.text: I have two greyhounds and saw several people in the dog parks with these water bowls. I bought one and have only two complaints. One, why is there no cover? I put this in the car and no matter what position it sits in when full it will splash out the opening. It needs a cover. Two , It would be great to have a larger size. Two big dogs and long walks equals an empty waterboy and two thirsty dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Works great in our RV
customer_reviews.text: Works great in our RV. We leave it on the floor and even while driving we have not had spills, of course I can't speak for the dogs as they cover their muzzles with water and walk away dripping at each sip. Would have given a five, but if you allow the dogs to drink it down to a certain percentage the water is not above the little cage inside, so what I do is tilt it a little toward the bowl to ensure that does not happen.
customer_reviews.author: Tekmaniac

customer_reviews.title: Super item & so easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this more stars if I could! The Lixit Waterboy Travel Water bowl worked like a charm. No water spills and easy to use on the road. Like others have stated in previous reviews, this bowl worked so well, as soon as we got to our destination (just moved), it became the bowl that we us on a daily basis. Our dogs and cat all use this spill-proof water bowl together. If you are looking for an easy way to carry water on a road trip, but worry about water spilling, get this item! You will be happy to have a way to provide water to your animals, without having to stop and pour water.
customer_reviews.author: AmyC

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The bowl does not automatically fill with water. I have to tip it to get the bowl to fill. And I have to be there when my dogs are drinking it because it doesn't automatically fill up when the bowl is empty, even though the jug is full of water. And when it tips over when I am driving, which it does a lot, the water spills. Not as described.
customer_reviews.author: Dog and Pony Lover

customer_reviews.title: This is the best waterer for our big goofy yellow lab
customer_reviews.text: This is the best waterer for our big goofy yellow lab! He dunks his head when we give him a bowl and then drips all over the place. With this bowl, he can only get his chin in the water so way less mess. This is our second waterboy. The first is still going strong after probably 7 years, but we left it behind on a trip and don't want to be without it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Trouble free
customer_reviews.text: Love it. However, dogs splash a little on floor. But overall a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier. Hands down the best traveling dog bowl I have owned. I have it in the back of my outback full of water on long car journeys. My dog is a boxer (shot nose) and it’s easy for him to drink from, however I’ve seen friends dogs (lab long nose) have difficulties drinking from the bowl. Maybe just requires more practice? No water spillage even when car is in motion. Easy to clean and Refil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to take to the dog park--but all 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take to the dog park--but all 3 of my dogs drink from it--instead of their water bowl. We live where it gets really hot-- so I'm enjoying filling half of it with ice cubes, to keep the water cooler, longer. Also no water splashing everywhere, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Debbiemadison

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is great for road trips. We used it for with a 60 lb dog and a 4 lb dog on a road trip to Colorado and New Mexico. Both dogs could drink out of it easily, and we were able to stash it next to the seat without it spilling over.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Lillo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is amazing! It really works. Pick it up and the water in the bowl goes back into the reservoir, none on the floor. We travel by RV and I really needed a bowl that would not spill so I could leave water out all the time. Our dogs travel in their crates, but having the water available is one less thing to worry about. Wish I'd thought of it!
customer_reviews.author: PennyJeanAZ

customer_reviews.title: A must have for traveling with your furbaby
customer_reviews.text: A must have for traveling -- Houdini (my poochie) and I have traveled during the summer and winter with this bowl. In the summer, I put several cubes of ice in it to keep it cool. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ama Imani

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but has one problem
customer_reviews.text: We were planning to take this on a trip. The water dish works well, except it never closes completely off, so the water doesn't run out if it tips over. If you are carrying it in the car and it is not wedged securely in the upright position and it tips over, the water just runs out all over. As long as you always carry it by the handle and make sure it stays in an upright position it will work well. Already had one accident in our new car. Glad it was only water.
customer_reviews.author: Beckzilla51

customer_reviews.title: My dog prefers this to his normal water bowl
customer_reviews.text: I got this as something to keep in the car for traveling or the winter when the temps are not so hot and I can leave him in the car for a little while and then take him for a walk. I wasn't sure though how he would be with using it so I filled it up and then put it on the floor and he seems to use this one a great bit more than his other water bowl. I think it might be cooler because of how it sits on the floor and the material seems thinner than the other bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Supervised use only
customer_reviews.text: Our 5-month old male Lab couldn't figure out how to use a regular water bottle so we purchased this as an alternative for his cage. It works as advertised; doesn't spill and he drinks from it. Unfortunately this is, as the title says, a "travel" bowl that you whip out if need be and not as a bowl to leave at all times. Result? Barely a day and he already punctured the corner after treating it as a chew toy. Still works but it lost the spill-proof feature since flipping it will only make the water fall out of the hole. Supervised use only, guys!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for in the Jeep
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this. every time we go for a ride in the Jeep the first thing they do when they jump in is get a drink out of their bowl. Still makes a little mess (mostly my pups are sloppy drinkers). But this is very useful !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than lixit bottles
customer_reviews.text: Now I always have water available for my dog that comes to work with me every day. I have yet to have it spill when driving. The only thing to watch out for is lifting to the upright (carry) position too quickly. If raised too fast, the water in the bowl will spill out instead of running back into the container. Not a bad thing, just a learning curve. My pup took to it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought one about 10 years ago for my dogs who are always traveling with me. The inner rubber seal finally broke and this is my second one. It holds plenty of water for 3 German Shepherds and it doesn't leak or spill in the vehicle. By far the best pet travel water container.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana CTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car!
customer_reviews.text: SO FRICKEN FANTASTIC! I bought this bowl for a 3-day long training class wherein my dog would be spending a bit of time in the car and it worked so perfectly. It also stores in the car standing up (as shown) so when you are driving, just tip it up and drive off. Its completely wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: beth1307

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: these are the best watering bowls for our labs. one in each vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply a must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful travel bowl! you can take it anywhere and holds a good amount of water. If they designed a lid for this thing it would be absolutely perfect! I take this in the car, to the park, if visiting dog friendly friends or family! simply a must have!
customer_reviews.author: ikonkar

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2! Honestly Spill Proof
customer_reviews.text: A friend years ago got a water boy for 50 cents...it wasnthe BEST! Used in the garage for ten years. I didnt clean it well and it got algae. My fault, lived in WA. Ordered two for our no Arizona home! Its the only bowl Emma will use now! (Remington cares not) 🐾🐾🐾🐾
customer_reviews.author: Torie

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cats!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these to use with my cats when I go away on vacation. I previously had one of those automatic watering bowls with the giant water reservoir on top, but my cats thought this was a toy and would knock the whole thing down - which you can imagine resulted in water EVERYWHERE! I've been searching for a while for a solution and stumbled upon these dishes, not their intended purpose, but they sure did work great!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: but the problem was that he also loved to play with his water bowl and spill it ...
customer_reviews.text: This waterbowl has been a godsend to us. Our puppy is a camel and loves his water, but the problem was that he also loved to play with his water bowl and spill it everywhere. We were constantly cleaning up water bowl spills and constantly getting up to get him more water. With this, it lays low to the ground so even if Banjo messes with it, it's very very hard to flip over and spill. Also, we've only needed to refill the water once a day or so. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie L.

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the positive reviews, I bought this for a puppy who loves to dump his water dish and gets water all over the floor hoping this would work he still can spill it everywhere again I don't know how when it doesn't work its still got good reviews
customer_reviews.author: CharlotteMom104

customer_reviews.title: This is so useful and so great
customer_reviews.text: This is so useful and so great. My dog loves having water on the go. It's great in the back of my suv car. Only thing is, sometimes the water does come out and spill a little. I might be filling it up too much but it's still worth buying and great, but just wanted to let readers know... water does spill sometimes for me at least.
customer_reviews.author: Rza

customer_reviews.title: more hassle than a regular water bowl
customer_reviews.text: This only works if you keep it filled up to the very top, otherwise water doesn't even come up to the surface to get to. Our two big dogs didn't like it, shoved it around and chewed on it. It's easier to just put a mat under the water bowl.
customer_reviews.author: jimmie guillaume

customer_reviews.title: This gets pretty heavy and you need to push on it to ...
customer_reviews.text: This gets pretty heavy and you need to push on it to get the water level where you'd want it. For hiking, we would've been better off with a bottle version. If you have multiple dogs and are camping, would be good!
customer_reviews.author: FrequentShopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Car Trips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bowl a little skeptical because of the way it looks but trusting the reviews. We used it for an 8 hour car trip with a puppy in the backseat and it worked PERFECTLY! I am so glad we got it. The water never spilled. Highly recommend for the travelers! It holds a lot of water too. The only imperfection I can see is if you turn it right side up too quickly it will spill. Other than that, I can't say enough good things.
customer_reviews.author: snilian

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These things are great, they can actually sit on the back seat of your car
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: it seems like there's not much water available
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, the pets use it, but once the water level drops inside, it seems like there's not much water available. I think the cats like it better, since they are smaller and the low water level doesn't affect them much. My big dogs don't have access to a deep well of water, so it seems like they are not getting as much to drink.
customer_reviews.author: TechGoddess

customer_reviews.title: I loved my first one of these
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first one of these. It lasted me for years - a definite 5 star. It wasn't until someone stepped on it that it had a problem. The one I bought a few months ago and just started using, it doesn't form a tight seal and leaks all over the place in the car. The second one has been problematic.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S.

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional dog hiker and keep this in the back of my vehicle. The dogs love having access to water any time they choose. the little dogs like it and use it as much as the 100lb dogs. Before i bought it I read the comments about the seal leaking- so I never unscrew it to fill it up. I tilt it at a slight angle and put it under the tap to allow the air out and the water in. Such a great investment! Wonderful invention. I like it and the dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: Keely Catriona

customer_reviews.title: This is a great water bowl
customer_reviews.text: If you have a dog that rides in your car this is by far the best water bowl I've found to date. It's note entirely spill proof like they claim, but it's still a great way to travel with enough water for your dog. If I had one suggestion it would be to make the opening larger; it took me some time to train my guy to drink from it but after a while he's taken to it no problem. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Shmooty

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it, but still splashes
customer_reviews.text: My goofball dog won't drink out of his regular water bowl anymore. He loves this thing so much! That said, he still creates a small splash when he drinks and it is very possible to spill if you hold it wrong while walking. I think this will work for the purpose we bought it for, but we will still use a placemat under it.
customer_reviews.author: KarenTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: but it's great overall. My dog can drink in the back ...
customer_reviews.text: I still don't believe it works, but it does! Maybe a drop here or there, but it's great overall. My dog can drink in the back of a spritted Corvette ride without much mess.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We always travel with our dogs and they always managed to tip over their non spill bowls that were in the truck for them. The puppy happily chewed on them also. We found this bowl and it is wonderful. They have never been able to tip it over (though it will slide) and the puppy never bothered trying to chew on it. We now have two of them. One for each vehicle! Love these!
customer_reviews.author: JS49

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel bowl!
customer_reviews.text: Love these travel bowls. Work really well and the dogs like them and aren’t afraid of them. Great price! Bought one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Utawn
